#Text=Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment
#Text=Apartment-living is an attractive option for seniors who no longer need a big family home , or want to get the most out of their retirement savings by reducing extra costs .
#Text=But downsizing your home does n’t prevent you from throwing successful family parties in your apartment !
#Text=With simple planning , you can still bring everyone home for the holidays .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Plan your space .
#Text=Furnish your apartment with pieces that serve multiple purposes .
#Text=Stools and pillows look great and can be used for extra seating .
#Text=Tables that fold or expand can temporarily double your serving space .
#Text=Clear the Clutter .
#Text=Put away any knickknacks , counter clutter , and small decorative furniture .
#Text=Your valuables will not only be safe , but you will have more surface space and the room will seem bigger and more inviting .
#Text=Delegate .
#Text=Once your children have grown out of calling peanut butter and pickles a dinner , ask them to help with the preparations !
#Text=If each adult prepares an appetizer , desert or entrée , your preparation time will be cut significantly , your kitchen will stay cleaner and everyone will be able to contribute to the day .
#Text=Make after-party arrangements .
#Text=Are people coming from out of town ?
#Text=Will alcohol be served ?
#Text=Is transportation available ?
#Text=If any of your guests will need overnight accommodation , make sure arrangements are made before the big day .
#Text=A smaller home means less space for unexpected overnight guests .
#Text=Do n't forget the children .
#Text=If children are coming , make sure there is a safe space away from the excitement of the party available .
#Text=In an apartment , a bedroom or office can be used for this purpose .
#Text=Young children may become overwhelmed or tired before the day is through and having a ' children 's only ' area will make sure that they enjoy the day as much as the adults .
#Text=Eat simply .
#Text=Unless you are planning a formal dinner , serve simple food that wo n't stain clothes .
#Text=If everyone ca n't fit around a single table , skip the dinner time ordeal and allow your guests to mingle and graze the food .
#Text=Watch the clock .
#Text=Know when your guests are coming and leaving .
#Text=If your first guest arrives early and the last guest leaves late , the day can quickly become long and overwhelming .
#Text=Set a start and finish time for your gathering and you and your guests will get the most out of your time with each other .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Moving into a rented apartment does n't mean you have to give up your family traditions .
#Text=With just a bit of planning , you can still find room to accommodate everyone when celebrating family occasions .
#Text=Welcome your guests with a drink and offer to take any coats or bags .
#Text=This will help them feel more comfortable and integrate with the party sooner .
#Text=Save a room for coats and bags , such as a spare bedroom .
#Text=This will help your guests feel more safe that their belongings are n't next to the door .
#Text=If your guests have n't met before the party , introduce them to the others as they enter .
#Text=Have a list of taxi companies on standby for your guests leaving after consuming alcohol .
#Text=Do n't be afraid to cool the party down .
#Text=When it 's getting late and you feel the party should come to an end , politely tell them that they should think about how they 're going to get home .
#Text=It 's your home after all !
